questions.question: Is the Mustang logo visible and intact on the grille in all views?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the Mustang logo on the grille is a key identifier of the car's brand. Examining each view separately, the logo should be prominently displayed in the center of the grille. A consistent appearance of the logo in all views indicates the editor's attention to maintaining brand identity throughout the image. In Image B, the logo is visible and intact in all views, confirming the brand identity is preserved.

questions.question: Does the side view of the car include the GT badge?
questions.explanation: The GT badge is typically placed on the side of the car, often near the front fender or rear section. Such a badge signifies a higher performance variant of the vehicle. In Image B, the side view should display the GT badge somewhere on the side of the car, confirming its performance model. The GT badge is indeed visible on the side fender area in one of the views.

questions.question: Are the wheels depicted with the same black multi-spoke design in all views?
questions.explanation: A consistency check for detailed design elements like wheels ensures accuracy and realism in edited images. In Image B, analyzing all views, the wheels should match in design to maintain the integrity of the image. Observing all views in the collage, the car's wheels are consistently depicted with the same black multi-spoke design.

questions.question: Is the car consistently depicted in black with its original sleek shape across all views?
questions.explanation: To analyze this, examine the car's paint color and silhouette in each depiction. A consistent color and shape across various views reflect a cohesive editing process. In Image B, the car maintains a black color with its sleek, aerodynamic body style in all views.

questions.question: Do the headlights and exhaust outlets appear correctly placed and designed in all views?
questions.explanation: Correct placement of functional elements such as headlights and exhaust outlets affirms the accuracy of the car's representation. In Image B, each view should exhibit headlights in the standard frontal position and exhausts at the rear. The headlights and exhaust outlets are correctly placed and designed in all views in the edited image.
